alice.tucson.service

Class ACCProxyAgentSide

  • java.lang.Object
    • alice.tucson.service.ACCProxyAgentSide
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AsynchACC, BulkAsynchACC, BulkSynchACC, EnhancedACC, EnhancedAsynchACC, EnhancedSynchACC, OrdinaryAsynchACC, OrdinarySynchACC, RootACC, SpecificationAsynchACC, SpecificationSynchACC, SynchACC, UniformAsynchACC, UniformSynchACC

    public class ACCProxyAgentSide
extends java.lang.Object
implements EnhancedACC
    Active part of the Default Agent Coordination Context. It implements the underlying behavior needed by every TuCSoN Agent user to fruitfully interact with the TuCSoN Node Service TuCSoN. Essentially, it implements every method exposed in the Default ACC Interface default offered to the agent, maps each of them into TuCSoN Request Messages req, then waits for TuCSoN Node Services replies reply forwarding them to the agent. It also is in charge of establishing the first connection toward the TuCSoN Node Service and the specific tuplecentre inside it as soon as needed (that is, upon the first invocation of any method belonging to the ACC Interface). It is created from the TuCSoN Agent class. In it, an internal thread is responsible to obtain the choosen ACC (the Default is the only at the moment) by invoking the getContext static method from the TuCSoN Meta ACC class metaACC. The acquisition of such ACC triggers this proxy creation and execution.
    See Also:
    TucsonAgent, TucsonNodeService, DefaultACC, TucsonMsgRequest, TucsonMsgReply, TucsonMetaACC

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ACCProxyAgentSide(java.lang.Object aid)
      Default constructor: exploits the default port (20504) in the "localhost" TuCSoN Node Service
      ACCProxyAgentSide(java.lang.Object aid, java.lang.String node, int port)
      Complete constructor: starts the named TuCSoN Agent on the specific TuCSoN node listening on the specified port

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addOperationExpired(long id)
      Method to track expired operations, that is operations whose completion has not been received before specified timeout expiration
      void exit()
      Method to release the current ACC held by the TuCSoN Agent behind this proxy: it takes all the opened connection (we could have been interacting with different tuplecentres on the same node, hence interfaced by the same ACC) to quit them, sending a proper message to the TuCSoN Node involved.

    • Method Detail

      • out

        public ITucsonOperation out(java.lang.Object tid,
                   LogicTuple tuple,
                   TucsonOperationCompletionListener l)
                     throws TucsonOperationNotPossibleException,
                            UnreachableNodeException
        Out Linda primitive, asynchronous version. Inserts the specified tuple in the given target tuplecentre, WITHOUT waiting the completion answer from the TuCSoN node. The TuCSoN agent this proxy instance refers to will be asynchronously notified upon need (that is, when completion reply arrives). Such operation is delegated to a private method nonBlocking which maps it on a TucsonMsgRequest to send it to the TuCSoN Node Service for processing Notice that TuCSoN out primitive assumes the ORDERED version of this primitive, hence the tuple is SUDDENLY injected in the target space (if the primitive successfully completes)
        Specified by:
        out in interface OrdinaryAsynchACC
        Parameters:
        tid - Target TuCSoN tuplecentre id tid
        tuple - Tuple to be emitted in the target tuplecentre
        l - The listener who should be notified upon operation completion
        Returns:
        An object representing the primitive invocation on the TuCSoN infrastructure which will store its result
        Throws:
        TucsonOperationNotPossibleException
        UnreachableNodeException
        See Also:
        TucsonTupleCentreId, TucsonOperationCompletionListener, ITucsonOperation

      • in

        public ITucsonOperation in(java.lang.Object tid,
                  LogicTuple tuple,
                  TucsonOperationCompletionListener l)
                    throws TucsonOperationNotPossibleException,
                           UnreachableNodeException
        In Linda primitive, asynchronous version. Retrieves the specified tuple in the given target tuplecentre, WITHOUT waiting the completion answer from the TuCSoN node. The TuCSoN agent this proxy instance refers to will be asynchronously notified upon need (that is, when completion reply arrives). Notice that the primitive semantics is still SUSPENSIVE: until no tuple is found to match the given template, no success completion answer is forwarded to the TuCSoN Agent exploiting this proxy (but thanks to asynchronous behaviour, TuCSoN Agent could go something else instead of getting stuck) Such operation is delegated to a private method nonBlocking which maps it on a TucsonMsgRequest to send it to the TuCSoN Node Service for processing
        Specified by:
        in in interface OrdinaryAsynchACC
        Parameters:
        tid - Target TuCSoN tuplecentre id tid
        tuple - Tuple to be retrieved from the target tuplecentre
        l - The listener who should be notified upon operation completion
        Returns:
        An object representing the primitive invocation on the TuCSoN infrastructure which will store its result
        Throws:
        TucsonOperationNotPossibleException
        UnreachableNodeException
        See Also:
        TucsonTupleCentreId, TucsonOperationCompletionListener, ITucsonOperation

Notice that the primitive semantics is still SUSPENSIVE: until no tuple is found to match the given template, no success completion answer is forwarded to the TuCSoN Agent exploiting this proxy (but thanks to asynchronous behaviour, TuCSoN Agent could go something else instead of getting stuck) Such operation is delegated to a private method nonBlocking which maps it on a TucsonMsgRequest to send it to the TuCSoN Node Service for processing

        Inp Linda primitive, asynchronous version. Retrieves the specified tuple in the given target tuplecentre, WITHOUT waiting the completion answer from the TuCSoN node. The TuCSoN agent this proxy instance refers to will be asynchronously notified upon need (that is, when completion reply arrives). This time the primitive semantics is NOT SUSPENSIVE: if no tuple is found to match the given template, a failure completion answer is forwarded to the TuCSoN Agent exploiting this proxy Such operation is delegated to a private method nonBlocking which maps it on a TucsonMsgRequest to send it to the TuCSoN Node Service for processing

      • spawn

        public ITucsonOperation spawn(java.lang.Object tid,
                     LogicTuple toSpawn,
                     TucsonOperationCompletionListener l)
                       throws TucsonOperationNotPossibleException,
                              UnreachableNodeException
        SPAWN
        Specified by:
        spawn in interface OrdinaryAsynchACC
        Parameters:
        tid - the target TuCSoN tuplecentre id tid
        toSpawn - the tuple storing the activity to spawn as a parallel computation. Must be a Prolog term with functor name exec/solve, storing either a Java qualified class name (dotted-list of packages and .class extension too) or the filepath to a valid Prolog theory and a valid Prolog goal to be checked. E.g.: exec('list.of.packages.YourClass.class') OR solve('path/to/Prolog/Theory.pl', yourGoal)
        l - the listener who should be notified upon operation completion
        Returns:
        the interface to access the data about TuCSoN operations outcome.
        Throws:
        TucsonOperationNotPossibleException
        UnreachableNodeException
        See Also:
        TucsonTupleCentreId, TucsonOperationCompletionListener, ITucsonOperation, Theory, Term

        Inject in the space a list of tuples in one shot (a single transition step).

        out_all in interface BulkAsynchACC
        Parameters:
        tid - the TucsonTupleCentreId of the target tuple centre

        l - who to notify upon operation completion
        Returns:
        the ITucsonOperation object storing the outcome of the execution. Notice due to asynchronous semantics, there is no guarantee it will store the result of the operation at anytime but when asynchronously notified.
        Throws:
        TucsonOperationNotPossibleException
        UnreachableNodeException
        See Also:

      • out_s

        public ITucsonOperation out_s(java.lang.Object tid,
                     LogicTuple event,
                     LogicTuple guards,
                     LogicTuple reactionBody,
                     TucsonOperationCompletionListener l)
                       throws TucsonOperationNotPossibleException,
                              UnreachableNodeException
        Out_s Specification primitive, asynchronous version. Adds the specified Reaction Specification (wrapped in a Logic Tuple) in the given target tuplecentre, WITHOUT waiting the completion answer from the TuCSoN node. The TuCSoN agent this proxy instance refers to will be asynchronously notified upon need (that is, when completion reply arrives). Such operation is delegated to a private method nonBlocking which maps it on a TucsonMsgRequest to send it to the TuCSoN Node Service for processing Again, this TuCSoN out_s primitive assumes the ORDERED semantics, hence the reaction specification is SUDDENLY injected in the target space (if the primitive successfully completes)
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        TucsonOperationNotPossibleException
        UnreachableNodeException

        TucsonTupleCentreId, TucsonOperationCompletionListener, ITucsonOperation, RespectSpecification

      • in_s

        public ITucsonOperation in_s(java.lang.Object tid,
                    LogicTuple event,
                    LogicTuple guards,
                    LogicTuple reactionBody,
                    TucsonOperationCompletionListener l)
                      throws TucsonOperationNotPossibleException,
                             UnreachableNodeException
        In_s Specification primitive, asynchronous version. Retrieves the specified Reaction Specification (wrapped in a Logic Tuple) in the given target tuplecentre, WITHOUT waiting the completion answer from the TuCSoN node. The TuCSoN agent this proxy instance refers to will be asynchronously notified upon need (that is, when completion reply arrives). Notice that the primitive semantics is still SUSPENSIVE: until no Reaction Specification is found to match the given template, no success completion answer is forwarded to the TuCSoN Agent exploiting this proxy (but thanks to asynchronous behaviour, TuCSoN Agent could go something else instead of getting stuck) Such operation is delegated to a private method nonBlocking which maps it on a TucsonMsgRequest to send it to the TuCSoN Node Service for processing
        Specified by:

      • spawn

        public ITucsonOperation spawn(java.lang.Object tid,
                     LogicTuple toSpawn,
                     java.lang.Long timeout)
                       throws TucsonOperationNotPossibleException,
                              UnreachableNodeException,
                              OperationTimeOutException
        SPAWN
        Specified by:
        spawn in interface OrdinarySynchACC
        Parameters:
        tid - the target TuCSoN tuplecentre id tid
        toSpawn - the tuple storing the activity to spawn as a parallel computation. Must be a Prolog term with functor name exec/solve, storing either a Java qualified class name (dotted-list of packages and .class extension too) or the filepath to a valid Prolog theory and a valid Prolog goal to be checked. E.g.: exec('list.of.packages.YourClass.class') OR solve('path/to/Prolog/Theory.pl', yourGoal)
        timeout - the maximum waiting time for completion tolerated by the TuCSoN agent behind this ACC. Notice that reaching the timeout just unblocks the agent, but the request IS NOT REMOVED from TuCSoN node pending requests (will still be served at sometime in the future).
        Returns:
        the interface to access the data about TuCSoN operations outcome.
        Throws:
        TucsonOperationNotPossibleException
        UnreachableNodeException
        OperationTimeOutException
        See Also:
        TucsonTupleCentreId, ITucsonOperation

      • out_all

        public ITucsonOperation out_all(java.lang.Object tid,
                       LogicTuple tuple,
                       java.lang.Long timeout)
                         throws TucsonOperationNotPossibleException,
                                UnreachableNodeException,
                                OperationTimeOutException
        Description copied from interface: BulkSynchACC
        Inject in the space a list of tuples in one shot (a single transition step).
        Specified by:
        out_all in interface BulkSynchACC
        Parameters:
        tid - the TucsonTupleCentreId of the target tuple centre
        tuple - the list of tuples to inject (must be a Prolog list)
        timeout - the maximum waiting time for completion tolerated by the TuCSoN agent behind this ACC. Notice that reaching the timeout just unblocks the agent, but the request IS NOT REMOVED from TuCSoN node pending requests (will still be served at sometime in the future).
        Returns:
        the ITucsonOperation object storing the outcome of the execution. Notice due to synchronous semantics, it is guaranteed to store the result of the operation.
        Throws:
        TucsonOperationNotPossibleException
        UnreachableNodeException
        OperationTimeOutException

      • no_all

        public ITucsonOperation no_all(java.lang.Object tid,
                      LogicTuple tuple,
                      java.lang.Long timeout)
                        throws TucsonOperationNotPossibleException,
                               UnreachableNodeException,
                               OperationTimeOutException
        Description copied from interface: BulkSynchACC
        Checks absence from the space of any tuples matching the given template in one shot (a single transition step). In case of success, no difference can be perceived with no primitive. In case of failure, all the tuples matching the template are returned (with no only one non-deterministically selected is returned).
        Specified by:

        Returns:

      • out_s

        public ITucsonOperation out_s(java.lang.Object tid,
                     LogicTuple event,
                     LogicTuple guards,
                     LogicTuple reactionBody,
                     java.lang.Long timeout)
                       throws TucsonOperationNotPossibleException,
                              UnreachableNodeException,
                              OperationTimeOutException
        Out_s Specification primitive, synchronous version. Adds the specified Reaction Specification (wrapped in a Logic Tuple) in the given target tuplecentre, waiting the completion answer from the TuCSoN node for a maximum time specified in ms timeunit. Such operation is delegated to a private method blocking which maps it on a TucsonMsgRequest to send it to the TuCSoN Node Service for processing Again, this TuCSoN out_s primitive assumes the ORDERED semantics, hence the reaction specification is SUDDENLY injected in the target space (if the primitive successfully completes)
        Specified by:
        out_s in interface SpecificationSynchACC
        Parameters:
        tid - Target TuCSoN tuplecentre id tid
        tuple - Reaction Specification to be emitted in the target tuplecentre
        timeout - Maximum waiting time tolerated by the callee TuCSoN Agent
        Returns:
        The Logic Tuple resulting from the completion of the primitive
        Throws:
        TucsonOperationNotPossibleException
        UnreachableNodeException
        OperationTimeOutException
        See Also:
        TucsonTupleCentreId, RespectSpecification

      • inp_s

        public ITucsonOperation inp_s(java.lang.Object tid,
                     LogicTuple event,
                     LogicTuple guards,
                     LogicTuple reactionBody,
                     java.lang.Long timeout)
                       throws TucsonOperationNotPossibleException,
                              UnreachableNodeException,
                              OperationTimeOutException
        Inp_s Specification primitive, synchronous version. Retrieves the specified Reaction Specification (wrapped in a Logic Tuple) in the given target tuplecentre, waiting the completion answer from the TuCSoN node for a maximum time specified in ms timeunit. This time the primitive semantics is NOT SUSPENSIVE: if no Reaction Specification is found to match the given template, a failure completion answer is forwarded to the TuCSoN Agent exploiting this proxy Such operation is delegated to a private method blocking which maps it on a TucsonMsgRequest to send it to the TuCSoN Node Service for processing

                     java.lang.Long timeout)
                       throws TucsonOperationNotPossibleException,
                              UnreachableNodeException,
                              OperationTimeOutException
        Get_s TuCSoN primitive, synchronous version. Reads (w/o removing) all the Reaction Specifications in the given target tuplecentre, waiting the completion answer from the TuCSoN node for a maximum time specified in ms timeunit. Semantics is NOT SUSPENSIVE: if the specification space is empty, a failure completion answer is forwarded to the TuCSoN Agent exploiting this proxy Such operation is delegated to a private method blocking which maps it on a TucsonMsgRequest to send it to the TuCSoN Node Service for processing
        Specified by:

      • addOperationExpired

        public void addOperationExpired(long id)
        Method to track expired operations, that is operations whose completion has not been received before specified timeout expiration
        Parameters:
        id - Unique Identifier of the expired operation

      • exit

        public void exit()
          throws TucsonOperationNotPossibleException
        Method to release the current ACC held by the TuCSoN Agent behind this proxy: it takes all the opened connection (we could have been interacting with different tuplecentres on the same node, hence interfaced by the same ACC) to quit them, sending a proper message to the TuCSoN Node involved.
        Specified by:
        exit in interface RootACC
        Throws:
        TucsonOperationNotPossibleException
